is the northern region of the
. It is made up of the neighborhoods of

is mainly residential but has a few sites of minor note including the Sepulveda Unitarian-Universalist Society (nicknamed 'The Onion' for its appearance) and Bull Creek (where the motorcycle chase scene in Terminator 2 was filmed). North Hills has a deserved reputation as one of the Valley's major gang hotspots. Although generally safe during the day, exercise caution in this area at night.

The 405 Freeway runs north-south through North Hills. Exits in North Hills are on Roscoe and Nordhoff.

Northridge has a Metrolink Station at 8775 Wilbur Ave.  Service is Monday-Friday on the Ventura County Line.

value: name=Mission San Fernando Rey de España
directions=on San Fernando Mission Blvd between Interstates 5 and 405
content=Founded in 1797 by Fermin Lasuen, this historic complex has a church and museum and is the 17th of California's 21 Spanish Missions.  One of the few missions established

there had been significant development in the region. The Convento building (built in 1822) is apparently the largest adobe structure in California.  Following a 1971 earthquake, the mission was restored in 1974.  Bob Hope is buried in the memorial garden next to the church, and in the adjacent cemetery are buried Richie Valens and many other Hollywood celebrities who were Catholic.
name=Theodore Payne Foundation for Wild Flowers and Native Plants

content=The non-profit organization is the largest nursery devoted exclusively to California native plants in Los Angeles County, with more than 500 native species and a seed store with more than 500 species available.  The organization operates an annual wildflower hotline by phone (818-768-3533) and website that lists wildflower sites throughout California. It also hosts an annual Fall Festival with speakers, exhibits and a plant sale. The organization also organizes an annual garden tour that features home gardens that are 50% or more native throughout the Los Angeles Basin.
address=9550 Haskell Ave. North Hills, CA 91343
content=Local landmark from the 1960s. Many events are held here from many different cultural and religious traditions.

around the intersection with Hayvenhurst and Plummer, is where the motorcycle and semi truck chase scenes from Terminator 2 where filmed. The flood canal is not open to the public but can be viewed from sidewalks.

The sprawling campus of California State University Northridge (18111 Nordhoff St) with its art galleries, botanical gardens, much-filmed library (Sky High, Star Trek, etc), and one of the last remaining orange groves in the Valley.
content=A large indoor shopping mall anchored by Sears, Macy's, and JC Penney. There are also many businesses around it including Borders Books, Best Buy, Guitar Center, and Kmart.

, 9039 Lindley Ave. Popular hot dog stand since the 1960s.

18110 Parthenia St. (818) 407-1498.  Authentic Indian market and cafe.
content=Famous chain of Southern California burger drive-ins. Open to 1AM (1:30AM on Fridays and Saturdays).
content=Delicious sushi. They have all you can eat for around $25 too. Try the house special roll and tempura roll.

content=Slightly upscale neighborhood lounge with karaoke and live music on some nights.

Sepulveda Boulevard in North Hills is lined with cheap motels. Most of them used to cater to prostitution and drug activity but claim to have cleaned up. You should stay at them with low expectations.
